reviews.review_msg: Dr. Leroux is a great prof - explains concepts clearly and is very kind and approachable. One of the best profs from MBB that I've had. Quizzes in lab are fair and do-able. Final was tough because of limited time but there were no surprises. Would definitely take another class with Leroux

Of the 5 MBB courses I've taken, this was by far my most successful. The grading is split across a very diverse breakdown, giving plenty of opportunity to earn a decent grade. Dr Leroux's lectures & feedback give you literally everything that you need to succeed in this course. Don't skip lectures, stay on top of the work, & you will be rewarded.

Dr. Leroux was clearly very enthusiastic about this course. He was patient and always willing to help troubleshoot problems during the labs. Some of the quizzes were a little tricky but the lowest one ended up be dropped anyway. Make sure to attend lecture as they are not recorded and he might drop some hints about the quizzes and final.

Dr. Leroux was an excellent prof for MBB309W. The course itself is a lot of work, but the techniques are very useful and Dr. Leroux was very approachable and knowledgable whenever I asked for help. Weekly quizzes, final quiz, and lab reports were all graded fairly and ample time was given to complete each one. Would recommend!

I enjoyed having Dr. Leroux for MBB 309W. The labs were long (most go beyond 4 hours) and it was a writing-intensive course. However Dr. Leroux was VERY patient during labs and was always available for help and feedback. The weekly quizzes were not easy, but they prepared us well for the final quiz which was very fair.

Dr. Leroux made the labs and classes enjoyable and he was always available for help and feedback on assignments. This was very helpful as the class is a 4 credit W science course and a lot of material is covered. His clear and concise breakdowns of the assignments helped a lot as well. I would highly recommend taking MBB309W with Dr. Leroux.

Dr. Leroux was an amazing prof to take this course with. He was passionate about the material and about sharing some of his own research as well. Labs are long, but he never rushed anyone and helped out as much as possible. Lab reports are time consuming and lengthy, but that is the nature of the field. Overall great prof, and would take again.

Dr Leroux is very enthusiastic and passionate about the material he teaches and genuinely wants to see students succeed. He is approachable and friendly as well. The course is hard work, the labs are long but Dr Leroux and the TA allowed us to stay overtime and stayed until everyone was done. The marking of assignments and exams was very fair.

Very clear in lecture to prepare students for the lab portion of the class. Really wants students to understand biochemistry to prepare them for future endeavours, instead of regurgitating material. Final was difficult because it reinforced thinking about the "why" instead of straight memorization, but fair. Also, has a great sense of humour.

I found 309W a really enjoyable course and that was mainly due to Dr Leroux. Since 309W was an upper level MBB course a lot of material was covered but Dr Leroux's enthusiasm made the class enjoyable. He was really open to questions both during and after class. The course was very information dense so this made a huge difference as well.

Although the material can be a bit tricky at times, Dr. Leroux always takes the time in lecture to go over all aspects of the next lab and explains everything very clearly to make sure no one is lost or flustered during lab times. He is clearly very knowledgeable and very enthusiastic about the material he teaches and is always available to help.

Dr. Leroux is a great professor. He ensures that the students leaving his class have a firm understanding of the theoretical and practical aspects of the course concepts and are able to operate well in a lab environment. He was also always present and enthusiastic to answer any questions in lab. I highly recommend taking courses with Dr. Leroux.

Dr. Leroux is a great professor. He went through the course material clearly and in an organized manner. He was also present during the labs, and is willing to answer questions both in lecture and in lab. I think a huge majority of students do well in his class but don't end up writing reviews, making this site unrepresentative of his teaching.

Dr Leroux is a wonderfully hilarious professor who not only discusses lecture content in crystal clear detail, but also takes time to get to know his students in the lab! He made MBB309 very enjoyable, and I am glad to have taken this course with him as opposed to other (more difficult) MBB profs! I would definitely recommend taking 309W with him!
